symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases, up to 38°C

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.pattern: Present in some cases after treatment

vital_signs.pulse: 68 bpm in one case, 104 bpm in another

physical_findings: Normal physical examination in one case
Lymphadenopathy in the neck region in one case

lab_values.serum_troponin: Elevated (8.51 ng/mL, peak 12.8 ng/mL; normal < 0.30 ng/mL)
lab_values.transaminases (AST, ALT): Mildly elevated in one case (108 and 91, respectively)
lab_values.hs-cardiac troponin: Elevated (200 ng/L; ref. < 34 ng/L) in one case

risk_factors: Exposure to cats or other animals

imaging_findings.ECG: Subtle lateral ST elevations in one case, small q waves and t wave flattening in another
imaging_findings.coronary angiography: Normal coronary artery anatomy in one case
imaging_findings.echocardiography: Normal with LVEF 60-65% in one case, systolic dysfunction (LVEF 45%) with hypokinesia in another
imaging_findings.cardiac MRI: Biventricular myocarditis and failure with LVEF 45% and RVEF 41% in one case, myocardial necrosis in multiple segments in another, late gadolinium enhancement with non-ischemic, inflammatory pattern in another

required: Clinical presentation consistent with myocarditis (chest pain, fever, etc.)
Elevated Toxoplasma gondii serologies (IgM and IgG)
supportive: Cardiac MRI showing evidence of myocarditis
